title: [BUG/ISSUE] Can't log in to the Alpha client. Stuck at Authentication.
body:
So today I could finally download the Alpha Client(cuz I got my laptop back yay!)
I patched the normal client,
I downloaded the Alpha client,
I tried logging in to the Alpha client.

Result: I get stuck at Authentication every time. The blue wheel-thingy just keeps on spinning. (alternatively it also sometimes stops spinning after 15 plus minutes and displays "An Error has occurred while logging in, please try again later." Isn't 6 hours late enough? xD)

When I close the Alpha client and open the legacy client, login works just fine there.

Just now it even finished fully repairing the Alpha client, but the issue still persists.


The first time I tried it was like 6 hours ago and the issue is still there now.
I hope someone can help me with this.

replies.body:
Quick Update to all the people watching who maybe also have this Issue:

I've been in contact with the people from support for the past week and I've sent them a whole bunch of logs and stuff already.

At the moment they're analyzing all those and I'm expecting to hear from them again tomorrow or maybe the day after.

> [{quoted}](name=IEatLouis,realm=EUW,application-id=2E4zVIwd,discussion-id=Uep2WBVR,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2016-09-05T17:36:48.735+0000)
>
> Quick Update to all the people watching who maybe also have this Issue:
> 
> I've been in contact with the people from support for the past week and I've sent them a whole bunch of logs and stuff already.
> 
> At the moment they're analyzing all those and I'm expecting to hear from them again tomorrow or maybe the day after.

Thats a good news. Keep us updated.



Btw, I just tried to change language of client and I can login with my usual WiFi connection, but when I switch it to english I got stuck at authentication.

Hm, last Wednesday the guy from support who handles my ticket told me that the people from QA who analyze my logs need some more time for that(which is kinda understandable too considering that the logs and especially the process dumps I made are just sooo HUGE! :o) so by now they could write back any time, I guess...

and I wonder if you should open a seperate ticket about that language changing bit tho...
Just a quick couple of questions to see if I dig into this a little bit.  Are you on a wireless connection?  Also, are you seeing any indication of patching still when you attempt to login ?

Yes, I am always on a wireless connection. but playing League with 30-50 ms is normal for me so I don't have any problems with it normally.

And, no it didn't seem like it was still patching. It was just Authenticating.
Ok, thanks for the context.  Digging into it now.

Hey IEatLouis, 

Just a quick update (don't want to leave you hanging here)!  We've been trying to reproduce your bug report and we're finding that this particular error is incredibly rare and may be tied to account/computer.  On our side we've been unable to really pin down what exactly is going on without diving a bit deeper into the issue itself.

In order to triage further, would it be possible to submit a support ticket to player support (https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) and include all relevant information that you can?

For example: your summoner name, and if possible include the link to this post so we can tie it back to this specific issue.  

I've spoken with the support team and we're going to attempt to go through appropriate channels to try and deep dive {{champion:111}}  into this issue.  If you are able to continue to assist, that would be really awesome!

Sure, I mean I signed up for the Alpha for helping to find Issues for you to solve, didn't I? :D

And I feel like I'm doing a really good job at it, since I even managed to find something before I even signed in...(trying to be positive xD)

It isn't the first request I make to the Support, they've always treeted me well so far, so I'll just go over there and have a constructive little discussion with someone, which will hopefully lead to this issue being solved ^^

Thanks you, Codebear :)
No worries!  Keep finding those bugs!

Oh and this link (https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) links me to (https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests) instead and displays a Message at the top of the screen: **Request not found. You do not have access to request #0. It may have been solved or deleted.**

man I already found something new that's not supposed to be that way, I must be having a lucky day or something lol
Can you share the contents of your latest LeagueClient.log in "<your-install>\Logs\LeagueClient Logs" ?

http://www.filedropper.com/2016-08-26t04-22-04leagueclient

Here you go.
huh I didn't even know those existed :o working on it...
Same man new client sucks
lol I just saw this... you had this same issue 4 months ago, when I posted this pver a year ago back when the alpha client was in beta? xD Riot still hadn't fixed this? O.o

I'm also having this same problem. When i open the alpha client and login it says "An Error has occurred while logging in, please try again later." and if i click sign in again it says authenticating and loads forever. I would just use the legacy client, but when i try to login it says "Connection Failure: Unable to connect to the PVP.net server.". I tried uninstalling and reinstalling and repairing, but that didn't change anything. It was working yesterday.

And another update:

Riot Support told me that they had lots of problems with this issue but it should be fixed with the next patch. For me it's apparently already fixed, I don't know why it just worked from one day to the other in the middle of the patch cycle.
I hope it'll sort itself out for you guys too ^^
Can confirm, just tried to log in and it's fixed for me too! Thanks for all the big help Rito, finally I get to try out all the cool new features :>

I have this problem too and I use WiFi to connect my laptop to Internet and play LoL. The weird thing is when I switch to other WiFi network I can login to Alpha client, but on my home WiFi I keep getting authentication problem. I have no idea why this is happening, but I also noticed that I am able to login with change of IP adress (by using different WiFi). Maybe key is in IP adress.

Hi, I'm having the same issues as the person mentioned above (I'm on a wired connection though). I've already opened a ticket about this issue and the support told me after checking into every detail that they can't help me. But, seeing as I'm not the only one being affected by this, I surely hope that you might find a fix for this :)
